original: Berglin, Carl-Gustaf, socialläkare, Göteborg, f. 2/10/08 i Sthlm av Carl David B. o. Anna Maria Skotte. G. 44 m. Alice Biesèrt. Barn: Thomas f. 45. — Stud :ex. 26, med. kand. 30 o. med. lic. 36, alit i Sthlm. Tjg. v. kri-minolog. centr :ark. 34, bitr. läk. v. rättspsykiatr. klin. 36-39, civ:läk. i Finl. 40, tjg. v. med. klin. o. s. förste undiläk. v. Beckomberga sjukh., över-läk. v. rättspsykiatr. avd. v. S:t Jörgens sjukh. v. Gbg 46, socialläk. i Gbg sed. 46. Skr.: smärre skr. samt kyrkomusik. FFrK4kl.
translated: Berglin, Carl-Gustaf, social doctor, Gothenburg, born on October 2nd, 1908 in Stockholm to Carl David B. and Anna Maria Skotte. Married in 1944 to Alice Biesèrt and has one son, Thomas, born in 1945. He completed his undergraduate education in 1926, earned his Bachelor of Medicine in 1930, and his medical license in 1936, all in Stockholm. He worked at the Criminology Center archive in 1934, was a deputy physician at the forensic psychiatry clinic from 1936-1939, was a civilian physician in Finland in 1940, worked as a deputy chief physician at the Beckomberga Hospital's medical clinic, and served as head physician for the forensic psychiatry department at St. Jörgen Hospital in Gothenburg from 1946. He has written minor works and church music and is a member of the Royal Society of Freemasons (FFrK4kl.).

organization.name: Forensic Psychiatry Department at St. Jörgen Hospital
